item.title: Action in Hong Kong Equity Markets Stirs Most Excitement in Years
item.description: Hong Kong’s equity capital markets are seeing the most action in years, with multibillion dollar deals lifting the mood and fueling anticipation about more deals to come.
item.dc:creator: Julia Fioretti, Dong Cao

item.title: New Zealand All Blacks Rugby Team Sign Gallagher Insurance as Sponsor
item.description: New Zealand Rugby agreed a sponsorship deal with Gallagher Insurance that will give the US-based insurance brokerage naming rights on the playing kit of the All Blacks rugby team.
item.dc:creator: Tracy Withers

media:content.media:description: YOKOHAMA, JAPAN - OCTOBER 26: New Zealand perform a haka during the international rugby test match between Japan and the New Zealand All Blacks at Nissan Stadium on October 26, 2024 in Yokohama, Japan. (Photo by Koki Nagahama/Getty Images)

item.title: Oil Steadies With Focus on Canada Wildfires, US Crude Stockpiles
item.description: Oil steadied after a two-day gain as rains slowed the growth of some blazes which had disrupted Canadian crude production.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Chen

media:content.media:description: The Deer Park Complex oil refinery and petrochemical plant, owned by Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX), in Houston, Texas, US, on Saturday, March 8, 2025. Some 40% of the crude oil processed at US refineries is imported, and Canada and Mexico, the No. 1 and No. 2 foreign suppliers of oil to the US, respectively, together deliver more than two-thirds of that oil. Photographer: Mark Felix/Bloomberg

item.title: Stocks Rise After US Jobs Surprise, Korea Jumps: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asian stocks rose for the first time in four days after data showed the US labor market is holding up, easing concerns President Donald Trump’s tariff war is pushing the world economy into a downturn.
item.dc:creator: Anand Krishnamoorthy, Winnie Hsu

media:content.media:description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Katie Greifeld, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec.

item.title: Toyota Industries Shares Slide on Buyout Discount Blowback
item.description: Toyota Industries Corp. shares fell the most in nine months after the Toyota group unveiled a ¥4.7 trillion ($33 billion) plan to privatize Toyota Industries Corp., drawing sharp criticism from investors and analysts who say the proposal significantly undervalues the company.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Takahashi

item.title: Lagarde’s ECB Future Set for Scrutiny After WEF Job Speculation
item.description: Christine Lagarde is about to face scrutiny on her commitment to keep leading the European Central Bank, not least as she nears the milestone of having just about tamed inflation.
item.dc:creator: Jana Randow, Craig Stirling

item.title: Poland to Hold Rates, Focus on Glapinski’s Tone
item.description: Poland is set to keep interest rates on hold, with investors focusing on central bank Governor Adam Glapinski’s outlook for borrowing costs following a pivotal presidential election.
item.dc:creator: Agnieszka Barteczko, Barbara Sladkowska

item.title: Former S.Korean Trade Minister Yeo on Trade Outlook
item.description: Han-koo Yeo, Peterson Institute for International Economics Senior Fellow and Former South Korean Trade Minister, discusses the economic and trade outlook for the country after South Koreans elected Lee Jae-myung as their new President, following months of political turmoil after a martial law declaration late 2024. He speaks with Shery Ahn and Paul Allen on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade". (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: China Consumers Get Thrifty During Holidays as Spending Stumbles
item.description: Chinese consumer spending faltered during a major holiday even as more people hit the road, suggesting a trade truce with the US is failing to turn around sentiment in an economy reeling from Donald Trump’s tariffs.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Fran Wang

item.title: China Bond Futures Trade Dwindles as Market Awaits Xi-Trump Call
item.description: Transactions in China’s long-term sovereign bond futures are cooling as traders hold off making bets in the market given continued tariff disputes with the US.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Wenjin Lv

item.title: Vietnam Orders Action to Avert Power Crunch as Heat Lifts Demand
item.description: Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh has ordered government agencies to ensure uninterrupted power supplies for households and businesses as heat waves boost electricity demand to a record.
item.dc:creator: Srinidhi Ragavendran, Giang Nguyen

item.title: Gold Edges Up on Dip-Buying, Persistent Trade War Worries
item.description: Gold edged higher after falling in the previous session, buoyed by Asian bargain-hunters as concerns resurfaced over the impact of US President Donald Trump’s trade war.
item.dc:creator: Jason Scott, Yihui Xie

item.title: Korean Stocks Set for Bull Market, Bonds Tumble After Election
item.description: South Korea’s equity benchmark climbed and is on track to enter a bull market, after Lee Jae-myung’s widely-expected win in the presidential election ended a months-long political leadership vacuum.
item.dc:creator: Jaehyun Eom, Youkyung Lee

item.title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 6/4/25
item.description: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Seoul and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Paul Allen, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Iran Oil Flows to China Fall on Sanctions, Refinery Maintenance
item.description: Iran is shipping less oil to China, as toughening sanctions snarl the OPEC producer’s shipments and refinery demand falls in the world’s biggest fossil fuel importer.
item.dc:creator: Yongchang Chin

item.title: Overweight US and Asia Equities, HSBC’s Sels Says
item.description: Willem Sels, Global CIO at HSBC Global Private Banking & Premier Wealth, says “we’re rebuilding our equity exposure with overweights in the US and in Asia.” Sels also discusses his outlook for the US economy and opportunities in fixed income. He speaks on Bloomberg Television.

item.title: Indian Stocks Bullish Momentum Takes a Pause
item.description: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:
item.dc:creator: Chiranjivi Chakraborty

item.title: Petronas Is Said to Weigh Sale of $7 Billion Canada Business
item.description: Petroliam Nasional Bhd. is considering options for its Canadian company formerly known as Progress Energy Resources Corp., including a sale, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Dinesh Nair, Elffie Chew

media:content.media:description: The Petroliam Nasional Bhd. logo. Photographer: Dimas Ardian/Bloomberg

item.title: China’s Wheat Harvest Risks 7-Year Low as Farmers Battle Drought
item.description: China’s wheat output could drop as much as 5% this year to the lowest since 2018, after recent drought in key growing regions stressed the crop.
item.dc:creator: Hallie Gu

item.title: Mexico Will Ask US Government for Steel Tariff Exemption
item.description: Mexico will ask Donald Trump’s administration this week to be exempted from an increase in steel tariffs to 50%, the country’s economy minister said on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Alex Vasquez

media:content.media:description: View of a truck loaded with steel rolls in the Lazaro Cardenas Cargo Port, Michoacan State, Mexico on April 25, 2025. (Photo by Alfredo ESTRELLA / AFP) (Photo by ALFREDO ESTRELLA/AFP via Getty Images) Photographer: ALFREDO ESTRELLA/AFP

item.title: Trump-Tied ‘Truth Social Bitcoin ETF’ Edges Closer to Launch
item.description: Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. appears to be one step closer to launching an exchange-traded fund tied to Bitcoin, joining the crowded field of crypto-investment offerings for the retail masses.
item.dc:creator: Vildana Hajric

media:content.media:description: A cartoon image of US President-elect Donald Trump holding a Bitcoin token to mark the cryptocurrency reaching over $100,000 displayed at a Coinhero store in Hong Kong, China, on in Hong Kong, China, on Thursday, Dec. 5, 2024. Trump's pick of a crypto proponent to be the next head of the US securities regulator liftedBitcointo $100,000 for the first time as traders warmed to the prospect of relaxed regulations. Photographer: Justin Chin/Bloomberg

item.title: CDL to Sell $2.1 Billion Singapore Office Site to Cut Debt
item.description: City Developments Ltd. agreed to sell its majority stake in one of Singapore’s most iconic office complexes, according to a person familiar with the matter, as the developer seeks to reduce debt and regain investor confidence after a family feud.
item.dc:creator: Dexter Low

media:content.media:description: The South Beach complex. Photographer: Lauryn Ishak/Bloomberg

item.title: Ping An Insurance Raises $1.5 Billion From Convertible Bonds
item.description: Ping An Insurance (Group) Co. of China Ltd. has sold HK$11.8 billion ($1.5 billion) in bonds that can be converted into shares listed in Hong Kong, marking the insurance giant’s second such offering in under a year.
item.dc:creator: Dave Sebastian

media:content.media:description: The Ping An International Financial Center in Beijing. Bloomberg

item.title: Garuda Said in Talks for $500 Million From Indonesia Wealth Fund
item.description: PT Garuda Indonesia is in talks with the country’s sovereign wealth fund Danantara about an injection of around $500 million, according to people familiar with the matter, as the struggling national carrier looks to turn its business around.
item.dc:creator: Leen Al-Rashdan, Danny Lee, Harry Suhartono

media:content.media:description: Ground crew members load luggage onto a flight at Soekarno-Hatta International Airport in Jakarta, Indonesia, on Sunday, Sept. 4, 2022. PT Garuda Indonesia has signed a financing facility agreement with state-owned asset management firm PT Perusahaan Pengelola Aset for fleet restoration and maintenance of aircraft spare parts.

item.title: Virgin Australia IPO Seeks $443 Million as Bain Rides Rally
item.description: Bain Capital-controlled airline Virgin Australia will relist in a A$685 million ($443 million) initial public offering, betting investors are brushing off the turmoil caused by US President Donald Trump’s trade war.
item.dc:creator: Angus Whitley

item.title: Tiger Management Alumnus Snoddy to Launch Japan Engagement Fund
item.description: David Snoddy, who ran the Tokyo office of Tiger Management before setting up his own firm, plans to launch a Japanese stock fund next month that focuses on companies with strong cash flows, solid balance sheets and excess cash.
item.dc:creator: Yasutaka Tamura

media:content.media:description: Pedestrians cross an intersection in the Shibuya district of Tokyo, Japan, on Thursday, Nov. 14, 2024. Japan’s economic growth slowed in the third quarter, boosting the case for the government to put together a stimulus package to be unveiled later this month. Photographer: Kentaro Takahashi/Bloomberg

item.title: Apollo Calls for ‘Tailored’ Private Markets Rules in Australia
item.description: Apollo Global Management, Inc. has warned Australia’s securities regulator against “broad brush” rules for unlisted investments and has called for regulation to instead target specific asset classes.
item.dc:creator: Richard Henderson

item.title: Global Funds Weigh Whether Indonesia Market Rebound Was Too Fast
item.description: Indonesia’s financial markets have bounced back after a torrid few months, sparking a debate on whether the rally can last.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Burgess, Prima Wirayani

media:content.media:description: Students as they wait for the lunch boxes to be distributed in the class room in Jakarta in 2024. Photographer: Rosa Panggabean/Bloomberg

item.title: South Korea Elects Lee President, Capping Six Months of Chaos
item.description: Lee Jae-myung, a left-leaning former labor activist, has been elected president of South Korea with 49.4% of the vote, marking a turning point for the country after six months of chaos following the debacle of martial law. Bloomberg's Seoul Bureau Editor Denny Thomas gives an overview of what we know about the new leader. He speaks on Bloomberg's The Asia Trade. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Bangladesh Taka Will Extend Slide on Election, Tariffs, BMI Says
item.description: The Bangladesh taka is set to extend this year’s decline due to potential political instability in the South Asian country and the increase in US tariffs, according to BMI, a unit of Fitch Solutions.
item.dc:creator: Malavika Kaur Makol
